title: Function-Based Mathematical Modeling Design and Application

context.prior_knowledge: Basic function concepts (linear/nonlinear functions), equation-solving skills, and simple data interpretation experience
context.additional_context: A course focused on enhancing mathematical modeling competencies for solving real-life problems. Includes data analysis and simulation using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can transform everyday problems (e.g., taxi fare calculation) into function-based mathematical models.
Learners can apply the mathematical modeling cycle (Formulate-Employ-Interpret/Evaluate) of the PISA framework to real-world problem-solving.
Learners can interpret modeling results, evaluate their validity, and propose improvement strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
